intro: Oreocharis obliquifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its unique, lance-shaped leaves that are often tinged with red or purple at the base. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
